Q2.ques: Which of the following languages are associated with cross-site scripting?

Q3.ques: Which attack can execute scripts in the user’s browser and is capable of hijacking user sessions, defacing websites or redirecting the user to malicious sites ?

Q4.ques: By exploiting XSS, an attackers can perform a variety of malicious activities, such as:
Q4.c: Access browser history and clipboard contents

Q6.ques: <script>document.write("Site is at: " + document.location.href + "."); </script>\nThis may lead to:

Q7.ques: XSS can be exploited by tampering parameters in GET request

Q8.ques: XSS can be exploited by including javascript in POST request
